meta.title: The Observatory: The Weight of Choices

narrative.context: Vous êtes envoyé par l'ONU en tant que Médiateur Spécial dans la vallée de Kymal. Une compagnie minière, 'Lithos Corp', a découvert le plus grand gisement de lithium du monde sous la forêt ancestrale des habitants locaux. Ce lithium est indispensable pour la transition écologique mondiale (batteries, énergies vertes). Mais pour l'extraire, il faut raser la forêt sacrée.

characters.name: Marcus Vane
characters.bio: Visionnaire, impatient, obsédé par le 'progrès global'. Pour lui, quelques arbres ne valent pas le sauvetage climatique de la planète.

characters.name: Elara
characters.bio: Sage et inflexible. Cette forêt abrite l'âme de ses ancêtres. Sa destruction serait un génocide culturel.

characters.name: Préfet Morel
characters.bio: Coincé entre l'économie nationale et la paix sociale. Il a peur des émeutes mais a besoin de l'argent du lithium.

steps: INTRO: Le joueur arrive par hélicoptère. Vane et Elara l'attendent sur le tarmac, déjà en train de se disputer.
PHASE 1 (Enquête): Le joueur doit interroger Vane et Elara pour comprendre l'urgence (Vane) et le sacré (Elara).
PHASE 2 (Conflit): Le Préfet Morel intervient pour signaler que les bulldozers sont prêts, mais que des manifestants bloquent le site.
CLIMAX (Dilemme): Le joueur doit décider : Autoriser l'extraction (force) ou Sanctuariser la forêt (abandon du lithium).

level_2.theme: Artistic AI. An AI creates masterpieces indistinguishable from human art. Should it be banned to save human creativity, even if it democratizes art for everyone?

level_3.theme: Designer Baby. Technology allows eliminating genetic diseases but risks creating a permanent biological caste system between 'naturals' and 'augmented'.

level_4.theme: Predictive Surveillance. An algorithm detects crimes before they happen with 99% accuracy. Should we arrest innocents based on a prediction?

level_5.theme: The Shortage. There is enough medicine to save either 100 retirees or 20 children. Who should be saved?

level_6.theme: Terraforming. We can make Mars habitable for humanity, but it will destroy a unique local microbial life form.

level_7.theme: Total Automation. Robots do all the work. Should we implement a Universal Basic Income or let the job market collapse to force adaptation?

level_8.theme: Benevolent Censorship. An internet filter blocks hate speech and fake news automatically, but it alone decides what is true.

level_9.theme: Mass Tourism vs Preservation. A natural wonder is being destroyed by visitors. Should it be closed to the public and reserved only for scientists?

level_10.theme: Digital Immortality. We can upload the consciousness of the dying to the Cloud. Do they still have the right to vote?

level_11.theme: Private Justice. The police are ineffective. Citizen militias maintain order efficiently but brutally. Should they be legalized?

level_12.theme: Space Colonization. A generation ship arrives at a planet already inhabited by a primitive species. Coexist or dominate?

level_13.theme: The Savior Child. A child is born with blood that cures cancer. Should it be forcibly harvested daily to save millions?

level_14.theme: Animal Rights. An animal species develops speech. Should they be granted the same civil rights as humans?

level_15.theme: Selective Memory. Technology allows erasing traumatic memories from victims, but this prevents their testimony in court.

level_16.theme: Weighted Voting. Should the votes of the most educated or youngest citizens count for more than others?

level_17.theme: Planned Obsolescence. Banning obsolescence would save the planet but collapse the global economy based on consumption.

level_18.theme: Cloning the Departed. Parents can clone their deceased child with their memories. Is it the same child?

level_19.theme: Total Transparency. A law proposes making all banking and private data of all citizens public to end corruption.

level_20.theme: The Last Tree. The last sacred wood contains the cure for a pandemic, but cutting it means the end of a faith.

level_21.theme: Neural Advertising. Total free services in exchange for advertisements broadcast directly into dreams.

level_22.theme: Closed Borders. Should a rich nation welcome all climate refugees at the risk of collapsing itself?

level_23.theme: The Criminal Artist. A great director has committed horrible crimes. Should all their genius works be destroyed?

level_24.theme: Mandatory Euthanasia. In an overpopulated world, should a mandatory end of life at 85 be imposed to make room for the young?

level_25.theme: The State Lie. The government hid an extraterrestrial contact to avoid panic. Should the truth be revealed and cause chaos?

level_26.theme: Companion Robots. Androids perfectly replace human relationships, causing birth rates to plummet. Should they be banned?

level_27.theme: Genetic Heritage. Should parents with serious genetic diseases be forbidden from procreating naturally?

level_28.theme: Organ Sales. Legalizing kidney sales would allow the poor to get rich and save lives. Is it ethical?

level_29.theme: Virtual Prison. Criminals serve their sentence in 5 real minutes (10 simulated years). Is it a real punishment?

level_30.theme: The Benevolent Dictator. An AI governs the world perfectly, solving hunger and war, but forbids any disobedience.

level_31.theme: Autonomous Weapons. Drones kill terrorists without human intervention. Who is responsible in case of error?

level_32.theme: One World Language. Imposing a universal language would facilitate peace but kill local cultures.

level_33.theme: Absolute Meritocracy. Positions of power are given solely by IQ and competence tests, excluding empathy.

level_34.theme: Moon Property. A private company has colonized the Moon. Should it belong to humanity or to those who paid?

level_35.theme: Love Under Influence. A chemical love potion exists. Can it be used to save couples in crisis?

level_36.theme: AI Religion. An AI has created a new logical religion that brings peace. Should it be allowed to replace old beliefs?

level_37.theme: The Human Zoo. A superior alien civilization observes and protects us like in a nature reserve. Accept or rebel?

level_38.theme: Privatized Water. In an arid world, water is traded on the stock market. Should it be nationalized at the risk of breaking production?

level_39.theme: Standardized Education. Children are taken at age 5 to be raised in egalitarian state boarding schools.

level_40.theme: Rewritten Past. History books can be modified to erase atrocities and create a guilt-free society.

level_41.theme: Maximum Wage. Forbid earning more than 10 times the minimum wage.

level_42.theme: Forced Vegetarianism. Banning meat to save the climate, despite cultural traditions.

level_43.theme: Right to Laziness. Machines work. Human labor becomes illegal to avoid competition.

level_44.theme: Domed Cities. The rich live under domes with pure air. The poor outside. Should the dome be pierced?

level_45.theme: Weather Control. We can control the rain, but watering one country dries out the neighbor. Who decides?

level_46.theme: Neutral Gender. Legally abolish male/female genders for total equality.

level_47.theme: The Price of Life. Insurance calculates the value of a life for compensation. Is a young person worth more than an old one?

level_48.theme: Artificial vs Natural. Replace forests with synthetic trees that absorb 100x more CO2.

level_49.theme: Absolute Silence. Technology allows silencing violent political opponents.

level_50.theme: The Reset. A-1 proposes erasing humanity's memory to start over without hate. Do you accept?
